page.title: 04A rural policeman
page.content: The{local police constable}has been in the force for 10 years, having served five years in the RAF Police. He lives in the police station in Weeton and works his own hours. His 'beat' covers a large rural area. There is little crime, although poaching and sheep rustling are not unknown. {He wants to be looked on as a {friend and adviser.}Relations with the local people are good. They will invite him in for a cup of tea and ring him for advice. He likes his work and has no wish to change his job.{He would have no {hesitation in recommending a career in {the police force. Persistent critics of the police should spend some time with them. They might then see things differently!
